channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Roadworks been carried out this has been left, 13th January
item.description:
Bexley council carried out resurfacing in Hartslock drive and have left old tarmac in road this has been here nearly 4 weeks

item.title: Outside number 27, 13th January
item.description:
There has been a collapsed drain that is causing issues with the drains inside 27 belsize park. Thames watrer have been notified but they have not done anything about it. it is causing serious drainage issues
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Belsize Park, Belsize Park, Greater London

item.title: Large pothole at the junction with Hurst Road - extending out 10inches from the kerb, 13th January
item.description:
There is an ever expanding pothole and crumbling road surface when you approach the end of the road. There was clearly previous work done over a 6-8ft area at the end of the road adjoining to the hurst road surfacing. This breakage is on the section that joins to hurstwood avenue. It starts at the kerbside and extends into the road for a good 10 inches. This was smaller before christmas but has significantly increased following the cold snap weather we've had
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hurstwood Avenue, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bedframe dumped outside the school, 13th January
item.description:
Someone has flytipped outside the school car park. Looks like a bed frame. Please remove.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Battery Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing problem with dog fouling, 13th January
item.description:
I am writing to make a formal and urgent complaint about a serious and ongoing problem with dog fouling on Morden Street, located near Morden Mount Primary School. The amount of dog poo left along the pavement is excessive and completely unacceptable. There is a clear lack of control in this area. To give a specific example, I personally counted six separate dog poos on the same side of Morden Street within less than 60 metres. This shows how severe and persistent the problem is. Council officers can easily attend and check this themselves. I have attached photographs as evidence. This is not an isolated incident, it happens constantly and is getting worse. This street is used daily by families and children walking to and from school. I also have a toddler, and it has become extremely difficult and unsafe to walk outside without the risk of stepping in dog waste. This poses a serious health risk, particularly to young children. Despite the seriousness of the situation, there appears to be no effective enforcement or monitoring in this area. I am requesting urgent action, including: Increased street cleaning on Morden Street Clear warning signage Enforcement patrols and fines for irresponsible dog owners The current situation is unacceptable and shows a serious lack of control. I would appreciate confirmation that this complaint has been logged and clear information on what action will be taken.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Morden Street, Lewisham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge blocking pavement to wheelchair users, 13th January
item.description:

item.title: Large crack/hole in the road and pavement in Abbey Road, 13th January
item.description:
Large crack/hole in the road and pavement in Abbey Road - cars are unable to avoid it and it is damaging vehicles. There was a previous accident before where the car went into the flats at Rosia House's front garden and another accident nearly occurred today. Please can this be looked into asap as its causing issues for both pedestrians and drivers
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opposite the marriott hotel on adelaide road, 13th January
item.description:
A number of my neighbours have already reported the vibrations caused by the manhole and pothole on Adelaide Road, causing the row of houses on Hornby Close to vibrate violently. This is causing severe sleep deprivation and we believe the shaking has led to the damage of a radiator cover in one of our bedrooms. We will appreciate the matter being looked into urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alexandra Road, South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All lights out on the A bridge, 13th January
item.description:
Was told to re - report if the issue hadn't been fixed after 4 weeks. Its been 4 weeks and its not been fixed. All lights are out both sides of the pedestrian crossing section of the A bridge. This is the only pedestrian route to north Thamesmead and it feels very very unsafe. This really needs to be sorted before someone either has an accident as its that Dark especially on the north side or even worse is attacked.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings are very faded, 13th January
item.description:
The road markings at this yellow box junction have become significantly faded. During the evening hours, and particularly in adverse weather conditions such as rain or snow, the visibility of these markings is severely reduced, creating unsafe driving conditions and increasing the likelihood of unintentional violations and subsequent fines.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Taunton Road, Blackheath, Greater London
